Chris Coole is a Toronto based clawhammer banjo player of some renown (in fact he may be one of the best in the world). But itÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s with this, his first solo record, Old Dog, that Chris has really stepped out/up. The album features 5 original songs as well as some traditional numbers and covers of songs by The Band, John Hartford and Dave Dudley. The record also features friends on fiddle, pedal steel, mandola, cello and percussion. The song styles range from traditional folk to honky-tonk to contemporary bluegrass. I like that Old Dog has a nice, easy, casual feel. The record sounds organic and the songs are a natural for ChrisÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢ laid back vocal delivery and masterful guitar/banjo playing.
